item.title: SPC Severe Thunderstorm Watch 21
item.description:
WW 21 SEVERE TSTM AR KS MO OK 030650Z - 031100Z 

URGENT - IMMEDIATE BROADCAST REQUESTED
SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH NUMBER 21
NWS STORM PREDICTION CENTER NORMAN OK
150 AM CDT FRI APR 3 2015

THE NWS STORM PREDICTION CENTER HAS ISSUED A

* SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH FOR PORTIONS OF 
  NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS
  EXTREME SOUTHEASTERN KANSAS
  SOUTHERN MISSOURI
  EXTREME NORTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA

* EFFECTIVE THIS FRIDAY MORNING FROM 150 AM UNTIL 600 AM CDT.

* PRIMARY THREATS INCLUDE...
  SCATTERED DAMAGING WINDS LIKELY WITH ISOLATED SIGNIFICANT GUSTS
    TO 80 MPH POSSIBLE
  ISOLATED VERY LARGE HAIL EVENTS TO 2.5 INCHES IN DIAMETER
    POSSIBLE

THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH AREA IS APPROXIMATELY ALONG AND 60
STATUTE MILES EITHER SIDE OF A LINE FROM 40 MILES WEST NORTHWEST
OF JOPLIN MISSOURI TO 30 MILES NORTHEAST OF WEST PLAINS MISSOURI.
 FOR A COMPLETE DEPICTION OF THE WATCH SEE THE ASSOCIATED WATCH
OUTLINE UPDATE (WOUS64 KWNS WOU1).

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

REMEMBER...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH MEANS CONDITIONS ARE
FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS IN AND CLOSE TO THE WATCH
AREA. PERSONS IN THESE AREAS SHOULD BE ON THE LOOKOUT FOR
THREATENING WEATHER CONDITIONS AND LISTEN FOR LATER STATEMENTS
AND POSSIBLE WARNINGS. SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS CAN AND OCCASIONALLY
DO PRODUCE TORNADOES.

&&

OTHER WATCH INFORMATION...CONTINUE...WW 17...WW 18...WW 19...WW
20...

DISCUSSION...SVR MCS WITH HISTORY OF SEVERAL SIGNIFICANT-SVR GUSTS
AND SPORADIC LARGE/DAMAGING HAIL REMAINS WELL-ORGANIZED AND WILL
CROSS WW AREA...EVENTUALLY MOVING INTO MORE STABLE AIR BUT
CONTINUING HAIL/WIND THREAT IN MEANTIME.  REF SPC MESOSCALE
DISCUSSION 195 FOR ADDITIONAL/NEAR-TERM METEOROLOGICAL DETAILS.

AVIATION...A FEW SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WITH HAIL SURFACE AND ALOFT
TO 2.5 INCHES. EXTREME TURBULENCE AND SURFACE WIND GUSTS TO 70
KNOTS. A FEW CUMULONIMBI WITH MAXIMUM TOPS TO 500. MEAN STORM
MOTION VECTOR 29050.


...EDWARDS
Read more

item.title: SPC Tornado Watch 20
item.description:
WW 20 TORNADO AR MO 030635Z - 031400Z 

URGENT - IMMEDIATE BROADCAST REQUESTED
TORNADO WATCH NUMBER 20
NWS STORM PREDICTION CENTER NORMAN OK
135 AM CDT FRI APR 3 2015

THE NWS STORM PREDICTION CENTER HAS ISSUED A

* TORNADO WATCH FOR PORTIONS OF 
  NORTH-CENTRAL AND NORTHEASTERN ARKANSAS
  SOUTHEASTERN MISSOURI

* EFFECTIVE THIS FRIDAY MORNING FROM 135 AM UNTIL 900 AM CDT.

* PRIMARY THREATS INCLUDE...
  A FEW TORNADOES POSSIBLE
  ISOLATED DAMAGING WIND GUSTS TO 70 MPH POSSIBLE
  ISOLATED LARGE HAIL EVENTS TO 1.5 INCHES IN DIAMETER POSSIBLE

THE TORNADO WATCH AREA IS APPROXIMATELY ALONG AND 90 STATUTE
MILES EAST AND WEST OF A LINE FROM 15 MILES WEST OF BATESVILLE
ARKANSAS TO 20 MILES NORTHEAST OF POPLAR BLUFF MISSOURI.  FOR A
COMPLETE DEPICTION OF THE WATCH SEE THE ASSOCIATED WATCH OUTLINE
UPDATE (WOUS64 KWNS WOU0).

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

REMEMBER...A TORNADO WATCH MEANS CONDITIONS ARE FAVORABLE FOR
TORNADOES AND SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS IN AND CLOSE TO THE WATCH
AREA. PERSONS IN THESE AREAS SHOULD BE ON THE LOOKOUT FOR
THREATENING WEATHER CONDITIONS AND LISTEN FOR LATER STATEMENTS
AND POSSIBLE WARNINGS.

&&

OTHER WATCH INFORMATION...CONTINUE...WW 17...WW 18...WW 19...

DISCUSSION...MCS/QLCS WITH BOW/LEWP CIRCULATIONS AND EMBEDDED
SUPERCELLS WILL PROCEED ESEWD ACROSS OZARKS TO PORTIONS MS RIVER
VALLEY WITH POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING GUSTS...SPORADIC HAIL AND A FEW
TORNADOES POSSIBLE.  SVR TSTM WW WILL BE REQUIRED FARTHER W FOR MCS
MOVING OUT OF KS.  REF SPC MESOSCALE DISCUSSION 195 FOR SHORT-TERM
METEOROLOGICAL INFO.

AVIATION...TORNADOES AND A FEW SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WITH HAIL
SURFACE AND ALOFT TO 1.5 INCHES. EXTREME TURBULENCE AND SURFACE
WIND GUSTS TO 60 KNOTS. A FEW CUMULONIMBI WITH MAXIMUM TOPS TO
500. MEAN STORM MOTION VECTOR 29035.


...EDWARDS
Read more
